trans-unit.source: Provides control capability to validate that another control's value matches a provided regular expression.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This class behaves identically to the ASP.NET <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RegularExpressionValidator?displayProperty=fullName> control.
By default, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command> controls on a form raise validator controls on the form to perform validation when the form is submitted to the server.
To disable automatic validation, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CausesValidation%2A> property on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command> to `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.RegularExpressionValidator"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Virtual method for derived class to create its own aggregated Web validator.
The Web validator is for getting and setting of the common properties of Web base validator.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An aggregated Web validator.
Called during the validation stage when ASP.NET processes a Web page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the validator is valid, otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the regular expression assigned to be the validation criteria.
The default value is an empty string ("").
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The regular expression assigned to be the validation criteria.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.RegularExpressionValidator"></xref> does not perform validation on an empty string.

To test for an empty string, use the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.RequiredFieldValidator"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.RegularExpressionValidator"></xref> controls together.
The regular expression assigned was malformed.
